item.title: Understanding Dominator Trees
item.description:
“Brief Discussion on Dominator Trees Dominator trees are an important concept in graph theory, with wide applications in compiler optimization, program analysis, and other fields. I want to help everyone understand this concept through some simple explanations.

First, what is dominance? In a directed graph, if all paths from the starting point to a node v must pass through node u, then we say node u dominates node v, denoted as u dom v. Intuitively, to reach v, one must first pass through u - u acts like a “checkpoint” guarding access to v.
